sentence.Network_en: If it comes to the crunch, I'll resign over this.
sentence.Network_cn: 必要时，我会为此而辞职。

sentence.Network_en: He can rely on my support when the crunch comes.
sentence.Network_cn: 关键时刻，他可以依靠我的支持。

sentence.Network_en: The Prime Minister is expected to call a crunch meeting on Monday.
sentence.Network_cn: 预计首相将于周一召开紧急会议。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent. (as a verb): variant of 17th-cent. cranch (probably imitative), association with crush and munch

entry.def: If you crunch something hard, such as a sweet, you crush it noisily between your teeth.

example.ex: She sucked an ice cube into her mouth, and crunched it loudly...
example.tran: 她吸了块冰块到嘴里，嘎嘣嘎嘣地大声嚼着。

entry.def: If something crunches or if you crunch it, it makes a breaking or crushing noise, for example when you step on it.

example.ex: A piece of china crunched under my foot...
He crunched the sheets of paper in his hands.
example.tran: 他把那沓纸揉得嚓嚓响。

entry.tran: (在小石子铺成的路上)嘎吱嘎吱地行进
entry.def: If you crunch across a surface made of very small stones, you move across it causing it to make a crunching noise.

example.tran: 我嘎吱嘎吱地走过石子路。
嘎吱嘎吱地驶过石头路面的车轮

entry.def: You can refer to an important time or event, for example when an important decision has to be made, as the crunch .

example.tran: 明天可就是紧要关头了。

example.ex: He can rely on my support when the crunch comes...
example.tran: 关键时刻，他可以依靠我的支持。

entry.tran: (用计算器或计算机大量地)处理(数字)
entry.def: To crunch numbers means to do a lot of calculations using a calculator or computer.

example.ex: I pored over the books with great enthusiasm, often crunching the numbers until 1:00 a.m.
example.tran: 我兴致勃勃地研究这些账簿，经常计算到凌晨1点。

entry.tran: 缺少资金;经济收缩;财政困难
entry.def: A situation in which a business or economy has very little money can be referred to as a crunch .

example.ex: The UN is facing a cash crunch.
example.tran: 联合国面临着现金短缺问题。

example.ex: ...a financial crunch that could threaten the company's future.
example.tran: 可能会威胁到该公司前途的财政危机

sentences.sentence: "he heard the crunch of footsteps on the gravel path"

means.word_mean: 2. a critical situation that arises because of a shortage (as a shortage of time or money or resources);

sentences.sentence: "his shoes were crunching on the gravel"

means.word_mean: 2. press or grind with a crunching noise
4. reduce to small pieces or particles by pounding or abrading;

auth_sentence.content: Neutrinos have sufficient weight to allow the Big Crunch!
auth_sentence.res_content: Neutrinos have sufficient weight to allow the Big Crunch!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Neutrinos have sufficient weight to allow the Big Crunch!

auth_sentence.content: There is a similar crunch time looming on Europe.
auth_sentence.res_content: There is a similar crunch time looming on Europe.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There is a similar crunch time looming on Europe.

auth_sentence.content: In a crunch, ETF investors can sell intraday.
auth_sentence.res_content: In a crunch, ETF investors can sell intraday.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In a crunch, ETF investors can sell intraday.

Sentence.sentence: Now we increasingly get rustle and crunch.

sentences.en: The dog was crunching a bone.
sentences.cn: 狗正嘎吱嘎吱地嚼骨头。

sentences.en: Our feet crunched on the frozen snow.
sentences.cn: 我们的脚嘎吱嘎吱地踩在冻雪上。

sentences.en: Caarackle! A cheery crunch, scraps of miniature thunder sound as the shells collapse.
sentences.cn: 嘎嘣！欢快的裂壳声像是一片微弱的雷鸣。

jushi.english: His leather boots crunched on the frozen snow.
jushi.chinese: 他的皮靴踩在冻雪上嘎吱作响。

jushi.english: The greedy boy was crunching on a hard and dry piece of toast.
jushi.chinese: 那个贪吃的男孩正嘎吱嘎吱地嚼一片烤过的脆面包。

jushi.english: He sat there crunching his cornflakes and reading the newspaper.
jushi.chinese: 他坐在那儿一边看报，一边嘎吱嘎吱地嚼着玉米片。
